thread.title: Gucci Mane Announces First Tour | Pitchfork
thread.title_full: Gucci Mane Announces First Tour | Pitchfork

title: Gucci Mane Announces First Tour | Pitchfork
text:
Gucci Mane Announces First Tour Following a prolific year of releases Gucci Mane Photo by Paras Griffin/Getty Images for Atlantic Records 
After a prolific 2016, Gucci Mane is gearing up for the first tour of his career. The Trap God Tour kicks off April 5 in Boston and includes both dates at Coachella before concluding with both stops at JMBLYA festival in Dallas and Austin. Find the full itinerary below. Last May, Gucci Mane was released from prison early after serving a two-year sentence. Since then, he’s gotten engaged to his longtime girlfriend, connected with his “favorite author” Malcolm Gladwell, and released three new albums and several other free releases. 
Gucci Mane: 
04-05 Boston, MA - House of Blues04-06 Wallingford, CT - Oakdale Theatre04-09 New York, NY - Terminal 504-12 Chicago, IL - Chicago Theatre04-13 Milwaukee, WI - Eagles Ballroom04-14 Detroit, MI - The Fox Theatre04-15 Indio, CA - Coachella04-16 Santa Ana, CA - The Observatory04-17 San Francisco, CA - The Warfield04-18 Portland, OR - Theatre of the Clouds04-20 Denver, CO - Ogden Theatre04-22 Indio, CA - Coachella04-24 Columbus, OK - Express Live!04-25 Philadelphia, PA - The Liacouras Center04-26 Pittsburgh, PA - Stage AE04-27 Washington, DC - Echostage
